constraints.rule: The promotion is classified as a game of chance.
Winners must be selected at random.
All eligible entrants must have an equal chance to win regardless of method of entry.
Consideration may not be required unless a free Alternate Method of Entry (AMOE) is provided.
A sweepstakes that includes consideration without a free AMOE is considered an illegal lottery.
AMOE entry may require only minimal information such as name, address, email, and phone number.
Requiring entrants to visit a physical store is classified as consideration.
Entrants may not be automatically entered unless the existence of an AMOE is clearly disclosed.
Eligibility is limited to residents of the 50 United States and Washington, D.C.
Eligibility may be restricted geographically, including by state, radius, or address.
Eligibility may be limited to predefined groups such as members of a loyalty program.
Advertising must be targeted only to individuals eligible to participate.
If the total prize pool exceeds $5,000 and New York or Florida residents are eligible, the sweepstakes must be bonded and registered in each applicable state.
Rhode Island registration is required only if the total prize value exceeds $500 and entry occurs at a physical retail location within the state.
Winners receiving prizes valued over $600 require enhanced identity verification.
All winners must sign an affidavit confirming eligibility and granting permission for use of name, image, likeness, and entry.
Winners receiving prizes above the reporting threshold must complete IRS Form W-9 and the sponsor must file a 1099-MISC or 1099-NEC.
Alcohol- and tobacco-related prizes are subject to additional regulatory scrutiny.
Alcohol- and tobacco-related prizes receive heightened scrutiny.
